Top court upholds Sarkozy's conviction of illegal campaign financing
subhead: Sarkozy was found to be the beneficiary of illegal campaign financing in 2012 through a double-billing system to cover costs. It is the former French president's second definitive conviction.

title: 'The Voice of Hind Rajab': The final moments of a Palestinian girl killed by Israeli fire
subhead: Kaouther Ben Hania's film features the audio recording of the child, made on January 29, 2024, as she called Palestinian Red Crescent rescuers.

title: How PSG wants its youth academy to become its main talent supplier
subhead: The reigning European champions, aiming for a more measured transfer strategy, hope to one day field a starting 11 entirely of homegrown players. The reality on the pitch is still far from that.

title: Four reasons French winegrowers are angry
subhead: Wine production in 2025 is expected to match that of 2024, which was already a disastrous year. Le Monde examines the four main factors behind this downturn.

Forgotten Louvre security report highlighted specific balcony used by crown jewel thieves
subhead: Le Monde has learned that a 2018 security audit explicitly identified the balcony used by the thieves as a point of vulnerability, even noting the possibility that a freight lift could be used to access it.

title: Niklas Frank, a son consumed by hatred for his Nazi father
subhead: Niklas Frank, an 86-year-old former journalist, is known in Germany for his absolute loathing of his father. As a Reich official, Hans Frank, appointed by Hitler in Poland, was among those sentenced to death at the Nuremberg trials, which began 80 years ago.

title: Boualem Sansal: 'At my age, I am not about to learn to hold my tongue...'
subhead: The French-Algerian writer, who has been in France since November 18, has regained his freedom, including his freedom of speech. He recounts his yearlong detention in Algeria, discusses the remarks that led to his arrest, and reflects on the future of relations between France and Algeria.
